@jingshanglu Is there any progress?

I guess the following description in [1] is what you are looking for.

```
Broadcast Table

It refers to tables that exist in all sharding database sources. Their structures and data are the same in each database. It can be applied to the small data volume scenario that needs to correlate with big data volume tables to query, dictionary table for example.
```

[1]https://shardingsphere.apache.org/document/current/en/features/sharding/concept/sql/

Hi @xunyard ,

Currently, we suggest users achieve the load-balance of Sharding Proxy by `LVS` or `F5` . On the other hand, I am interested in your approach. Could you provide a more detailed log about the exception when the configuration is `mysql:loadbalance`? 
I am considering how to load balance leveraging the power of the database. Do you think PostgreSQL has a similar JDBC driver property?

@lwh-0739 Hello, thank you very much for your feedback. 😊 Just like the code you showed, the interval sharding algorithm is implemented based on `LocalDateTime`, which requires us to define parameters in the datatime format. You can adjust the configuration to avoid this error:

```properties
spring.shardingsphere.rules.sharding.sharding-algorithms.test.type=INTERVAL
spring.shardingsphere.rules.sharding.sharding-algorithms.test.props.datetime-pattern=yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss
spring.shardingsphere.rules.sharding.sharding-algorithms.test.props.sharding-suffix-pattern=yyyyMM
spring.shardingsphere.rules.sharding.sharding-algorithms.test.props.datetime-lower=2018-06-01 00:00:00
spring.shardingsphere.rules.sharding.sharding-algorithms.test.props.datetime-upper=2021-12-31 00:00:00
spring.shardingsphere.rules.sharding.sharding-algorithms.test.props.datetime-interval-amount=6
spring.shardingsphere.rules.sharding.sharding-algorithms.test.props.datetime-interval-unit=MONTHS
```
In addition, you can also implement custom algorithms through SPI to meet your needs.

> Hi @xunyard ,
> 
> Currently, we suggest users achieve the load-balance of Sharding Proxy by `LVS` or `F5` . On the other hand, I am interested in your approach. Could you provide a more detailed log about the exception when the configuration is `mysql:loadbalance`?
> I am considering how to load balance leveraging the power of the database. Do you think PostgreSQL has a similar JDBC driver property?

Thanks for reply  @tristaZero ,

`F5` was first used to make HA for sharding-proxy, but some problems happened. F5 was gave up, because we are not familiar with it, at the same time without enough time. 


### F5 problem

- Sometimes error may occur when executing simple query SQL such as `select * from table-xxx`.
- Maybe other problems, I can't remember more...

### Loading-balance problem

Error occur for sharding-proxy [follows](https://github.com/apache/shardingsphere/blob/master/shardingsphere-proxy/shardingsphere-proxy-backend/src/main/java/org/apache/shardingsphere/proxy/backend/communication/jdbc/connection/BackendConnection.java) line 93. Just forbidden swith schema during transaction process.

I thought this maybe some mistake between mysql's loading-balance strategy for switch schema, so follow stuff found:

- mysql's loading balance proxy [LoadBalancedConnectionProxy](https://github.com/mysql/mysql-connector-j/blob/release/8.0/src/main/user-impl/java/com/mysql/cj/jdbc/ha/LoadBalancedConnectionProxy.java) (line 602) will try to pick new connection after `commit` or `rollback` is called.
- sync will be executed when `target` connection chosen during [pick](https://github.com/mysql/mysql-connector-j/blob/release/8.0/src/main/user-impl/java/com/mysql/cj/jdbc/ha/MultiHostConnectionProxy.java) (line 405) process. `target` connection will copy `source` connection's `autocommit` and `database`.
- autocommit flag still be `false` when `sync` method mentioned above is under executing, with 'change schema' followed.

conclusion:
1. `autocommit` status sync maybe drawback for loading-balance switch, or maybe the real pick could happen after a complete transaction and so on. 
2. mysql server can accept the logic of switching schema during transcation, so just considering the possibility of supporting it (I don't know about PostgreSQL, so please give your viewpoint).

Also, I will try for find more kind of adjust in client side, maybe loading-balance stratgy or other stuff. Hope for your point.

4. Please add unit test in `PostgreSQLDataSourceMetaDataTest`.

Hi @tristaZero,

Thanks, more for your problem:

1. `LoadBalancedConnectionProxy` created when `loadbalance` presents in jdbc url, during connect process. It also cover the implement of balance based on strategy, such as random(default), bestResponseTime, serverAffinity.
2. `transaction` is necessary to focus, because `switch connection` executes surely  at the end of `transaction`. Finally trigger ShardingSphere to run into Line 93 of `BackendConnection`.
